Class Market

  • java.lang.Object
    • Market

  • public class Market
extends java.lang.Object
    A market is an artificial job market of companies and agents.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Market(java.util.List<Person> employees, int nrCompanies, int capacity)
      Construct a job market.

      • Market

        public Market(java.util.List<Person> employees,

        Construct a job market.
        Parameters:
        employees - agents to be matched to companies
        nrCompanies - number of companies
        capacity - number of employees each company can hold

      • match

        public Company match(Person employee)
        Find the company with remaining capacity that is the closest match to an agent's preference ranking.
        Parameters:
        employee - the agent for which to find the optimal match
        Returns:
        the company that is the best match

      • run

        public int[][] run()
        Perform a simulation run. Matches all agents on the market to the companies on the market.
        Returns:
        distribution statistics after the run

      • runRandom

        public void runRandom(int rounds,
                      int lag)
        Perform a simulation run where agents are sampled randomly from the market with replacement. Sampled agents are matched to companies. For each agent that is added to a company, one random employee is removed from its company, keeping the total number of agents assigned to companies constant.
        Parameters:
        rounds - the number of agents to sample in total
        lag - the number of agents to add before one agent is removed for every agent that is added

      • statistics

        public int[][] statistics()
        Compute the number of employees for each company and the number of these that are minorities.
        Returns:
        a matrix of companies (rows) vs. number of minority employees (first column) and total number of employees (second column)

      • dissimilarity

        public double dissimilarity(int[][] statistics)
        Compute the dissimilarity coefficient from a matrix of minority vs. total employee statistics.
        Parameters:
        statistics - a matrix of statistics as returned by the statistics method
        Returns:
        the corresponding dissimilarity coefficient

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(java.lang.String delim1,
                                 java.lang.String delim2)
        Pretty print distribution statistics and dissimilarity coefficient.
        Parameters:
        delim1 - delimiter to use between statistical measures for each company
        delim2 - delimiter to use between companies
        Returns:
        distribution statistics and dissimilarity coefficient in readable form

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Formats distribution statistics and dissimilarity coefficient in a readable form. Calls toString(delim1,delim2) with tab and new line.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
